docs.lead_paragraph: Like most political junkies, President Obama said he keeps an eye on the blogs and the cable shows. So, he assured anxious House Democrats on Thursday, he fully understands what they have been going through in the tumultuous health care debate.

headline.main: Obama Seeks to Reassure House Democrats

docs.abstract: President Obama, in a speech to the Democrats on their retreat, promises to press their case in the midterm elections.
docs.snippet: President Obama, in a speech to the Democrats on their retreat, promises to press their case in the midterm elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: In her column today, Gail Collins goes into what she calls a rant.
docs.abstract: Why is it that senators from states with less health insurance are more likely to be against a health care bill that would extend insurance?
docs.snippet: Why is it that senators from states with less health insurance are more likely to be against a health care bill that would extend insurance?

docs.lead_paragraph: The House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, and the majority leader, Representative Steny H. Hoyer, Democrat of Maryland, said on Thursday that the final version of major health care legislation will be posted on the Internet for 72 hours before the House votes on the measure.

headline.main: Final Health Care Bill to Be Available Online

docs.abstract: House Democratic leaders promise 72 hours to review the final legislation online.
docs.snippet: House Democratic leaders promise 72 hours to review the final legislation online.

docs.lead_paragraph: Look, up in the sky! There it is! About to float behind that cloud - it's the Democrats' big trial balloon on a deal with organized labor leaders over a proposed excise tax on high-cost, employer-sponsored health insurance plans.

headline.main: More on the Deal to Tax Health Insurance

docs.abstract: Do Congressional leaders really have an agreement?
docs.snippet: Do Congressional leaders really have an agreement?

docs.lead_paragraph: At the crux of the debate over major health care legislation is the question of why health care in America is so expensive - or to be more precise, why the cost of medical care has been growing far faster than the cost of everything else. It is far outpacing regular inflation and threatening to bust not only the federal budget but the finances of individuals and families as well.

headline.main: Senator Grassley Joins the Cost Conversation

docs.abstract: Senator Charles E. Grassley explains why he thinks pending health care legislation won't lower health care costs.
docs.snippet: Senator Charles E. Grassley explains why he thinks pending health care legislation won't lower health care costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Should someone in Idaho or Nevada have significantly different health care coverage from someone in Massachusetts?

headline.main: Proposals Clash on States' Roles in Health Plans

docs.abstract: Lawmakers must decide whether they want a federally regulated insurance system or one in which states continue taking the lead on overseeing insurers and enforcing the rules.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers must decide whether they want a federally regulated insurance system or one in which states continue taking the lead on overseeing insurers and enforcing the rules.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House and Congressional leaders have reached a tentative deal on a proposed excise tax on high-cost, employer-sponsored insurance plans to be included in the final version of major health care legislation, according to officials familiar with the talks.

headline.main: Democratic Leaders Reach Compromise on Taxing Health Plans

docs.abstract: White House and Congressional negotiators say they have reached a deal on a controversial excise tax.
docs.snippet: White House and Congressional negotiators say they have reached a deal on a controversial excise tax.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update 6:53 Pacific Time | During cross-examination, Howard C. Nielson Jr., a lawyer for the defense, began by asking Dr. Meyer if he had donated money to defeat Proposition 8. Dr. Meyer confirmed that he had.
docs.abstract: On Thursday, the plaintiffs challenging the constitutionality of California's ban on same-sex marriage focused on economics. One witness, an economist working for San Francisco, said marriages boost tax revenue.
docs.snippet: On Thursday, the plaintiffs challenging the constitutionality of California's ban on same-sex marriage focused on economics. One witness, an economist working for San Francisco, said marriages boost tax revenue.

docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of New York City's massive public hospital system warned this week that the health care bills in Congress would burden safety net hospitals by failing to provide coverage for uninsured immigrants while also reducing federal payments for indigent care.

headline.main: City Hospital Chief Calls for Coverage of Immigrants

docs.abstract: The head of New York's public hospitals urged Washington to lift a five-year ban on health benefits for legal immigrants and to permit illegal aliens to purchase insurance on the proposed exchanges.
docs.snippet: The head of New York's public hospitals urged Washington to lift a five-year ban on health benefits for legal immigrants and to permit illegal aliens to purchase insurance on the proposed exchanges.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's payback time for 50 major banks and financial institutions that received support from the federal government during the depths of the economic crisis.
docs.abstract: The administration announces new bank fees today.
docs.snippet: The administration announces new bank fees today.
